Matplotlib Cheat Sheet

This resource summarizes common matplotlib operations used in data visualization.

Common Operations
	•	Creating basic plots
	•	Customizing labels and titles
	•	Adjusting styles and colors
	•	Saving figures

Why Useful

Matplotlib is the foundational plotting library in Python.
This cheat sheet helps beginners quickly recall common plotting syntax
for data analysis and visualization tasks.

## Import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Sample data
x = np.arange(0, 10)
y = x ** 2

# Basic line plot
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.show()

# Scatter plot
plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.show()

# Bar chart
plt.bar(x, y)
plt.show()

# Histogram
plt.hist(y, bins=10)
plt.show()

# Labels and title
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.xlabel("X axis")
plt.ylabel("Y axis")
plt.title("Simple Line Plot")
plt.show()

# Legend
plt.plot(x, y, label="y = x^2")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

# Figure size
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 5))
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.show()

# Grid
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Multiple lines
plt.plot(x, y, label="x^2")
plt.plot(x, x**3, label="x^3")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

# Save figure
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300, bbox_inches="tight")
plt.show()

# Clear figure
plt.clf()
